quest.name: My Little Chocobo (Twin Adder)
journal: Vorsaile believes it past time you were issued a personal chocobo.

To obtain your personal chocobo, you must present Cingur with a Serpent Chocobo Issuance. This document can be obtained by exchanging company seals with the serpent quartermaster. Here's hoping you have been setting aside your seals...
Cingur brings you your bird, and it is love at first sight. Name your new companion, and make it official.
After much deliberation, you decide on a name worthy of the noblest steed. Inform Cingur to complete the last of the formalities.
And so begins the adventures of Forename Surname and Companion. May their friendship last for eternity!
objectives: Present a Serpent Chocobo Issuance to Cingur.

dialogue.name: Vorsaile
dialogue.text: Ah, [GC Rank][GC Rank][GC Rank] Surname. I understand you have been working tirelessly in Gridania's name. You are truly an example to your fellow Serpents.

dialogue.name: Vorsaile
dialogue.text: But tell me, have you ever felt as though you couldn't get to your destination quickly enough? That perhaps you could do with a swifter pair of legs?

dialogue.name: Vorsaile
dialogue.text: If so, you might consider getting a personal chocobo. You have yet to be issued your own bird, am I correct? Given your considerable talents, you should be able to obtain one in no time at all. Let me tell you how to go about it.

dialogue.name: Vorsaile
dialogue.text: First, you must obtain a Serpent Chocobo Issuance by exchanging company seals with the quartermaster. Once you have this deed, present it to our man Cingur, and he will furnish you with a suitable bird.

dialogue.name: Vorsaile
dialogue.text: To be issued a personal chocobo, you must first obtain a Serpent Chocobo Issuance by exchanging company seals with the quartermaster. Once you have this deed, present it to our man Cingur, and he will furnish you with a suitable bird.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Want a bird issued, you say? Then I'll need to see your Serpent Chocobo Issuance.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Yes, everything appears to be in order.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: A moment please. I'll be right back with your chocobo.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: And here he is! The fellow has been in high spirits the past few bells. He must have sensed that his master was coming!

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Now then, to make it official, you'll want to give your noble steed a name.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Want a bird issued, you say? Then I'll need to see your Serpent Chocobo Issuance. You can get one from the serpent quartermaster, over at the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Of course, you will need to exchange Serpent Seals for it. You can earn these by completing tasks for the Order of the Twin Adder, Gridania's Grand Company.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBO
dialogue.text: Kweh!

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Now then, to make it official, you'll want to give your noble steed a name.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Heh heh! I daresay he likes his name!

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: Here is your very own chocobo whistle. Simply blow into it, and your feathered friend will come bounding to your side.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: But do forgive him if he doesn't respond when summoned in crowded city areas or monster-infested lairs. Chocobos are stout-hearted creatures, but they have their limits.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: And lastly, I present you with your chocobo rider's license, as is required by law.

dialogue.name: Cingur
dialogue.text: And that concludes all the formalities! I wish you and your chocobo long years of fulfilling companionship!

dialogue.name: CHOCOBO
dialogue.text: Name Your Chocobo

dialogue.name: CHOCOBO
dialogue.text: Name

dialogue.name: CHOCOBO
dialogue.text: Names must be between 2 and 20 alphabetic characters.
